statute_details.official_name: District of Columbia Freedom of Information Act

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Public body must respond within 15 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays)
extension_conditions: Unusual circumstances as defined by DC Code § 2-532(d)
Body-worn camera video requests may take up to 25 days total

fee_structure.standard_copy_fee: Reasonable standard charges for document duplication
fee_structure.search_time_fee: Reasonable standard charges for search time
waiver_criteria: Fee reduction or waiver is in the public interest
Furnishing records primarily benefits the general public
Educational or non-commercial scientific institution for scholarly research

exemptions: Records relating to law enforcement activities
Documents subject to recognized legal privileges (attorney-client, work product)
Documents required to be withheld by federal or District law
Documents reflecting internal deliberative processes of government
Documents that would result in clearly unwarranted intrusion on personal privacy
Trade secrets and commercial or financial information that is privileged or confidential
Records of investigations by Office of Police Complaints
Records that would endanger life or physical safety of law enforcement personnel

requester_requirements.specific_format: Written request preferred; must reasonably describe records sought

response_format_options: Electronic format as requested by requester

oversight_body.name: DC Office of Open Government
oversight_body.role: Independent agency that investigates FOIA compliance complaints and can issue advisory opinions

validation_metadata.verification_notes: Verified current text including 2024 body-worn camera provisions
